newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo sells SAS stake for 221 mln skr capital gain.
newsitem.headline: Volvo sells SAS stake for 221 mln skr capital gain.

text.p: Swedish vehicle maker AB Volvo said on Wednesday it sold its entire stake in Scandinavian airline SAS for a capital gain of 221 million crowns ($28.6 million).
After news that Alfred Berg was handling a batch of 3.33 million shares, Volvo confirmed that it had sold its stake in SAS Sverige AB that amounted to 4.72 percent of capital and votes.
The sale was worth in total 319 million crowns but gave the company a capital gain of 221 million crowns.
Alfred Berg brokered the shares at 97 crowns a piece.
SAS shares on the Stockholm bourse were one crown higher at 93 crowns at 1455 GMT.
